intro: Knowltonia major, commonly known as the Florida flame anemone, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy, red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and often have a velvety texture. Knowltonia major thrives in wetland environments and is adapted to tolerate periodic flooding.
